noun.description: A tropical American monkey with coarse fur and a long bushy nonprehensile tail.

proper noun.description: (1870–1916), British short-story writer, born in Burma; pseudonym of Hector Hugh Munro. His stories encompass the satiric, comic, macabre, and supernatural, and frequently depict animals as agents seeking revenge on humankind.

origin: Late 18th century: via French from Tupi saui.
